page.title: 04HISTORY DOWNDERRY/SEATON
page.content: The farm settlements have remained unexpanded.The villages demonstrate phases of expansion.Much of the early farm based village remains as private housing.The great enlargement of the {1880}is recognised by the tall sometimes multistory semidetached and terraced houses.After{1920}some sustantial bungalows of sea-sand block were built. Two terraces of Council housing are still prominent.Less durable holiday homes in timber and asbestos were built in and near Seaton.These are presently being renovated to 1985 standards. Wartime requirements{1939}caused much construction in the village to service a large R.A.F. radio location station. Postwar these structures were adapted to form the first homes of many new and newly married families who are now the backbone of the villages.
